[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetBalance()] [Owner Validation] Does the function validate that input.Owner is a valid non-null address before querying balances? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetBalance()] [TokenHash Recalculation] Line 34 recalculates tokenHash instead of using a cached value - can symbol/tokenId manipulation cause different hashes than the actual stored token? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetBalance()] [Balance Overflow] Can stored balance values exceed Int64 limits causing overflow when returned in GetBalanceOutput? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetBalance()] [Privacy] Can an attacker query arbitrary owner addresses to map token distribution and identify whale holders for targeted attacks? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetBalance()] [Negative Balance] Does State.BalanceMap enforce non-negative balances or can corrupted state lead to negative balance returns? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetBalance()] [Burned Token Balance] Can an attacker query balances for burned tokens to detect burn operations and track token destruction? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetBalanceByTokenHash()] [Direct Hash Access] By accepting tokenHash directly, can an attacker bypass CalculateTokenHash validation and query arbitrary State.BalanceMap entries? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetBalanceByTokenHash()] [Hash Collision Attack] Can an attacker precompute hashes to find collisions allowing balance queries for tokens belonging to different symbol/tokenId combinations? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetBalanceByTokenHash()] [Zero Hash] What happens if input.TokenHash is Hash.Empty or null - does it return balance for an invalid token entry? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetBalanceByTokenHash()] [Owner Address Null] Does the function validate input.Owner before accessing State.BalanceMap[input.TokenHash][input.Owner]? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetBalanceByTokenHash()] [State Corruption] If BalanceMap is corrupted with invalid entries, can this function return incorrect balances leading to double-spend vulnerabilities? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetBalanceByTokenHash()] [Enumeration Attack] Can an attacker systematically try different token hashes to map all balances in the system? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetBalanceByTokenHash()] [Return Value Consistency] Does this function return the same balance as GetBalance for equivalent inputs, or can discrepancies be exploited? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetAllowance()] [Allowance Overflow] Can allowance values stored in State.AllowanceMap exceed safe integer limits causing overflow in transfer operations? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetAllowance()] [Uninitialized Allowance] What value is returned if State.AllowanceMap[tokenHash][input.Owner][input.Spender] was never set - zero or undefined? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetAllowance()] [TokenHash Recalculation Risk] Can symbol/tokenId manipulation at line 56 cause different tokenHash than the actual approved token, returning wrong allowance? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetAllowance()] [Owner/Spender Validation] Does the function validate that Owner and Spender are valid distinct addresses before querying allowances? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetAllowance()] [Self-Approval] Can Owner == Spender scenario cause unexpected allowance values that bypass transfer restrictions? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.NFT/NFTContract_View.cs] [Function: GetAllowance()] [Negative Allowance] Can corrupted state lead to negative allowance values being returned, causing underflow in transfer calculations? (High)
